text:
Hi guys, has anyone on here held copy/content against a contact property, then used hubl to populate that content? I'm talking full paragraphs of text in some cases, image urls for src, etc. What have your findings been, too much system strain? Bugs?

It's very hacky....but I can't think of any other way to dynamically populate content into emails, based off of contact properties. e.g Contact property "last viewed product" = "XYZ". Show product copy XYZ and Image XYZ. (Smart content and lists are fine, but there is a limit of 20 variants and we have 100s of products.

i want to add image in hubdb in image column from fetch image url this api - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/form-integrations/v1/uploaded-files/signed-url-redirect> but not display image in hubdb,  display correct in page view.

This is actually fairly common among our e-commerce customers.  The only thing to look out for is the character limit of a property, which is something in the 56k range (I don’t remember exactly off the top of my head but can find out if you need a more precise number)
Rendering paragraphs, or even blocks of HTML is well within the bounds of the system so you shouldn’t be seeing any kind of performance hit. If you do, we definitely want to know about it.
Has anyone migrated pages from one portal to another after migrating the templates? Any good ideas on how to do it efficiently without recreating them?

We recently launched our website but are struggling to get the base domain <http://qsa-global.com|qsa-global.com> to point to the actual website <https://www.qsa-global.com> I am sure I am missing something simple. Does anyone have tips on pointing the root domain to the HubSpot CMS website? It has the right IP when I ping it but results in a Request Timed Out.
Hi Jayme - Which provider is your domain with?
I use a service called <http://nakedssl.com|nakedssl.com> there is a free tier but if you want responsive service i would pay the base fee.

The image resize function on the file manager/CDN seem to no longer be working. Does anyone else see this problem?
Orig:
>  <https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hub/1641088/hubfs/CalendarHeader.jpg>
Resized that used to work but no longer:
> <https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hub/1641088/hubfs/CalendarHeader.jpg?length=300&name=CalendarHeader.jpg>
I tried using the portal domain as well to no avail.  I also tried another portal, same problem.

You do have the correct IP, and it seems to be redirecting just fine for me.  If you’re still having issues, it could be:
1. An old redirect is cached on your browser - try to clear cache or use a different browser
2. DNS hasn’t propagated to you but it’s been a few hours so it might work for you now
3. You’re using <https://qsa-global.com> instead of <http://qsa-global.com> - the redirect IP won’t handle https root redirects.
4. You are in an office network which has an internal DNS server, and that domain is being resolved by the internal DNS server. You’ll have to contact your network folks to fix this.
<http://nakedssl.com|nakedssl.com> will handle naked ssl redirects. You should look into it
Hey <@U7TAZ6V2Q>, I’m looking into this. Likely will not have a response tonight, but will get back to you as soon as I do.
